title: Sintering of Porous Titanium Using the Spark Plasma Sintering Technique for Application as a Joint Prosthesis
content: The stress shielding phenomenon causes bone deterioration generating problems in joint prostheses, this phenomenon is caused by the difference in stiffness between titanium element and bone [1], so it is sought to generate a porous material to reduce the elastic modulus of the material. The spark plasma sintering (SPS) technique is proposed since it allows working with much shorter times and lower temperatures than conventional sintering techniques [2].
